channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Six months of 'shock and awe' on immigration enforcement
item.description:
Since returning to office, President Trump has moved swiftly to upend decades of federal policy—from education to healthcare to vaccines...but nowhere more aggressively than immigration.

Congress just passed tens of billions in funding for immigration enforcement...It's the largest domestic enforcement funding in U.S. history, fueling Trump's mass deportation campaign of migrants living in the U.S. illegally.

President Trump campaigned for office promising the largest deportation in history.

Six months into his second term, how has immigration enforcement changed.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Since returning to office, President Trump has moved swiftly to upend decades of federal policy—from education to healthcare to vaccines...but nowhere more aggressively than immigration.

Congress just passed tens of billions in funding for immigration enforcement...It's the largest domestic enforcement funding in U.S. history, fueling Trump's mass deportation campaign of migrants living in the U.S. illegally.

President Trump campaigned for office promising the largest deportation in history.

Six months into his second term, how has immigration enforcement changed.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: DREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS / AFP)

item.title: OK, is Martin Van Buren responsible for the tiny word that punches above its weight?
item.description: From Buenos Aires to Bangkok, Montreal to Moscow, nearly every taxi driver in the world understands "OK." It's a gift from American English that's spread across the globe in less than 200 years.
item.content:encoded:
From Buenos Aires to Bangkok, Montreal to Moscow, nearly every taxi driver in the world understands "OK." It's a gift from American English that's spread across the globe in less than 200 years.

(Image credit: National Archives/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Trump's new AI policies keep culture war focus on tech companies
item.description: A new executive order instructs tech companies to address what the White House sees as "woke AI." Receiving future federal contracts could hinge on whether AI firms respond.
item.content:encoded:
A new executive order instructs tech companies to address what the White House sees as "woke AI." Receiving future federal contracts could hinge on whether AI firms respond.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to fire 3 Democrats on consumer safety panel
item.description: The decision further limits a 90-year-old high-court precedent that was aimed at protecting the independence of certain regulatory agencies.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

The decision further limits a 90-year-old high-court precedent that was aimed at protecting the independence of certain regulatory agencies.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Tesla profits slide 16%, despite Elon Musk's pivot back to his companies
item.description: The earnings report follows a 13.5% drop in sales this quarter, compared to the same period a year ago.
item.content:encoded:
The earnings report follows a 13.5% drop in sales this quarter, compared to the same period a year ago.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: The Etan Patz case changed how America responds to missing kids
item.description: Six-year-old Etan Patz disappeared while walking to a school bus stop in 1979. The publicity of the case led to a societal shift and greater coordination among law enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
Six-year-old Etan Patz disappeared while walking to a school bus stop in 1979. The publicity of the case led to a societal shift and greater coordination among law enforcement.

(Image credit: Emmanuel Dunand)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: As lawmakers head into August recess, the Epstein controversy keeps bubbling
item.description: As Democrats push to release Epstein-related files, a former Justice Department official says the public may never see the full details.
item.content:encoded:
As Democrats push to release Epstein-related files, a former Justice Department official says the public may never see the full details.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: A carbohydrate revolution is fueling cyclists in the Tour de France
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Tim Podlogar, who researches exercise metabolism, about how elite cyclists consume thousands of calories each day to compete in the Tour de France.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Tim Podlogar, who researches exercise metabolism, about how elite cyclists consume thousands of calories each day to compete in the Tour de France.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Nations must act on climate change or could be held responsible, top U.N. court rules
item.description: The International Court of Justice ruled that nations have an obligation to act on climate change under international laws protecting the environment and human rights.
item.content:encoded:
The International Court of Justice ruled that nations have an obligation to act on climate change under international laws protecting the environment and human rights.

(Image credit: Peter Dejong)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: Judge denies release of Jeffrey Epstein transcripts in Florida
item.description: President Trump had called for the release of grand jury testimony related to Epstein. Two judges in New York also are weighing requests from the Justice Department to unseal grand jury transcripts.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump had called for the release of grand jury testimony related to Epstein. Two judges in New York also are weighing requests from the Justice Department to unseal grand jury transcripts.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
